breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Caryophyllaceae

source.author: Adams, L.G.
source.title: Caryophyllaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Adams, L.G. (1996). Caryophyllaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Sepals c. 2–4 mm long, erect to spreading in fruit; seeds not tumid-reniform, with a dorsal groove
Sepals 1.5 mm long, tightly appressed to ripe capsule; seeds tumid-reniform, lacking a dorsal groove
Annual with slender branching taproot; stems erect or ascending, lacking sterile axillary shoots and rarely mat-forming; mature fruiting sepals ovate
Perennial with fibrous roots, often adventitious from nodes; stems diffusely branching with sterile axillary shoots common, often mat-forming; mature fruiting sepals broad-ovate to suborbicular
Leaves subulate, aristate, at least the upper often basally ciliate; inflorescence often glandular; fruiting sepals spreading, usually distinctly shorter than capsule
Leaves linear, obtuse or acute, often minutely mucronate but not aristate or ciliate; inflorescence never glandular; fruiting sepals erect, c. equalling capsule
